result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew X. Winters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew X. Winters is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew X. Winters was found guilty of Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Matthew X. Winters was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $100 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   May not have contact with Robert S, John W, or Ashley R or their residences, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

May not have contact with Robert S, John W or Ashley R or their residences, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVOKED   -  BOTH COUNTS ARE CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER AND TO 14CM1563, 15CF160 & 15CF896

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Extended Supervision

Count 1 - 2 yrs WSP; 1 1/2 yrs Initial Confinement followed by 6 mo. ES. 
Count 5 - 4 1/2 yrs WSP; 1 1/2 yrs Initial Confinement followed by 3 yrs ES.
Not eligible for CIP or SAP

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and victim is present in court.  Sentencing arguments made.      
Count 1 - Defendant is sentenced to 2 years in the WSP forthwith; 1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 6 months of Extended Supervision.  
Count 4 - Defendant is sentenced to 4 1/2 years in the WSP forthwith; 1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision.
 DE is given 238 days sentence credit.  Both counts are concurrent and concurrent to 14CM1563, 15CF160 and 15CF896.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Court costs are ordered.   No contact with Robert S., John W. Ashley R. or their residence unless permitted by either the court or agent.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation of supervision, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (late) with Atty Donald Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions.  Count 4 - Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions.  Credit for 88 days served if probation is revoked.  Cash bonds in this file and 14CF1313 to be applied to fine & costs in this file and 14CM1563, 15CF160, and 15CF896; any balance may be returned to the poster.

2:20 p.m. - Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (late) with Atty Donald Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Prior orders vacated and bond reinstated.  Def. to meet with Atty Bielski to go over the presentence investigation.  Sentencing reset for 2/3/16 at 2:00.  Bond continued.

1:53 P.M. - Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Atty Donald Bielski appeared for def.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. does not appear.  Case set for sentencing today.  Def. was recently released from jail and Atty Bielski has been unable to meet with def. to review the PSI with him.  Due to non-appearance of def., cash bond ordered forfeited.  Bench warrant to issue; bond set at $5,000.00 cash.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Donald Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel. Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion, to be read in.  Counts 3, 5, and 6 - Dismissed on State motion.  Counts 1 and 4 - Pleas of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 1/14/16 at 1:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Donald Bielski.  Clerk: PT
Atty Bielski states an offer has been received and requests a brief adjournment to go over plea with defendant.  ADA Drees has no objection to scheduling a plea during ADA Binger's week.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew X. Winters appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.
